events.name: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_label: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: ICC Arrest Warrants
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: Allegations of Child Deportation
events.wd_description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.
events.description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.

events.name: Ukraine's Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.

events.name: Australian Bushfires in 2019-2020 Caused Significant Ozone Layer Depletion
events.wd_label: Australian Bushfires in 2019-2020 Caused Significant Ozone Layer Depletion
events.wd_description: A study published in the journal "Nature" revealed that the smoke from the Australian bushfires in 2019-2020 temporarily reduced the ozone layer's thickness by 3% to 5%, raising concerns about the impact of more frequent wildfires on ozone recovery.
events.description: A study published in the journal "Nature" revealed that the smoke from the Australian bushfires in 2019-2020 temporarily reduced the ozone layer's thickness by 3% to 5%, raising concerns about the impact of more frequent wildfires on ozone recovery.

events.name: Ozone Layer Depletion from Bushfire Smoke
events.wd_label: Ozone Layer Depletion from Bushfire Smoke
events.wd_description: The study found that smoke from the Australian bushfires in 2019-2020 reduced the ozone layer's thickness by 3% to 5% in 2020, highlighting the potential impact of wildfire aerosols on ozone depletion.
events.description: The study found that smoke from the Australian bushfires in 2019-2020 reduced the ozone layer's thickness by 3% to 5% in 2020, highlighting the potential impact of wildfire aerosols on ozone depletion.

events.name: Comparison to Antarctic Ozone Hole
events.wd_description: Lead researcher Prof Susan Solomon compared the ozone depletion caused by wildfire smoke to the Antarctic ozone hole, noting that similar ozone breakdown occurred at much warmer temperatures.
events.description: Lead researcher Prof Susan Solomon compared the ozone depletion caused by wildfire smoke to the Antarctic ozone hole, noting that similar ozone breakdown occurred at much warmer temperatures.

events.name: Future Implications for Ozone Recovery
events.wd_description: The study raises concerns that more intense and frequent wildfires could slow down future ozone recovery, as wildfire aerosols appear capable of enhancing ozone losses.
events.description: The study raises concerns that more intense and frequent wildfires could slow down future ozone recovery, as wildfire aerosols appear capable of enhancing ozone losses.

events.name: Surge in COVID-19 Deaths in China Following Lifting of Zero-COVID Policy
events.wd_label: Surge in COVID-19 Deaths in China Following Lifting of Zero-COVID Policy
events.wd_description: China experienced a significant surge in COVID-19 deaths after President Xi lifted the Zero-COVID Policy, with most deaths occurring among elderly individuals with underlying conditions.
events.description: China experienced a significant surge in COVID-19 deaths after President Xi lifted the Zero-COVID Policy, with most deaths occurring among elderly individuals with underlying conditions.

events.name: Surge in COVID-19 Deaths
events.wd_description: A significant increase in COVID-19 deaths has been reported in China since December 2022, particularly among individuals over 65 with underlying conditions, following the lifting of the Zero-COVID Policy.
events.description: A significant increase in COVID-19 deaths has been reported in China since December 2022, particularly among individuals over 65 with underlying conditions, following the lifting of the Zero-COVID Policy.

events.name: Lifting of Zero-COVID Policy
events.wd_description: The surge in COVID-19 cases and deaths began shortly after President Xi Jinping lifted China's Zero-COVID Policy, allowing for increased movement ahead of the holidays.
events.description: The surge in COVID-19 cases and deaths began shortly after President Xi Jinping lifted China's Zero-COVID Policy, allowing for increased movement ahead of the holidays.

events.name: International Response
events.wd_description: In response to the surge in COVID-19 cases and deaths in China, several countries issued mandatory testing for travelers coming from China.
events.description: In response to the surge in COVID-19 cases and deaths in China, several countries issued mandatory testing for travelers coming from China.

events.name: Expert Warnings and Travel Advisories
events.wd_description: Experts believe that the surge in deaths may have peaked in some areas but warned that increased travel could lead to a further rise in cases, advising people to limit visits to certain areas.
events.description: Experts believe that the surge in deaths may have peaked in some areas but warned that increased travel could lead to a further rise in cases, advising people to limit visits to certain areas.

events.name: Opening of Ascend Elements' lithium-ion battery recycling facility
events.wd_label: Opening of Ascend Elements' lithium-ion battery recycling facility
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements opened its first commercial-scale lithium-ion battery recycling facility in Covington, Georgia. The $50 million Base 1 facility is the largest EV battery recycling facility in North America.
events.description: Ascend Elements opened its first commercial-scale lithium-ion battery recycling facility in Covington, Georgia. The $50 million Base 1 facility is the largest EV battery recycling facility in North America.

events.name: Facility opening ceremony
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements celebrated the grand opening of its Base 1 facility on March 30, 2023, marking a significant milestone in EV battery recycling.
events.description: Ascend Elements celebrated the grand opening of its Base 1 facility on March 30, 2023, marking a significant milestone in EV battery recycling.

events.name: Initial operations
events.wd_description: The facility began partial operations in August 2022, with an annual capacity to process 30,000 metric tons of used lithium-ion batteries and manufacturing scrap.
events.description: The facility began partial operations in August 2022, with an annual capacity to process 30,000 metric tons of used lithium-ion batteries and manufacturing scrap.

events.name: t: Recycling process
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements uses its patented Hydro-to-Cathode™ process to recover up to 98% of critical battery metals and reduce the carbon footprint of new EV battery cathode materials by up to 90%.
events.description: Ascend Elements uses its patented Hydro-to-Cathode™ process to recover up to 98% of critical battery metals and reduce the carbon footprint of new EV battery cathode materials by up to 90%.

events.name: t: Employment details
events.wd_description: The facility currently employs about 100 team members, with plans to increase headcount to 185 by 2024.
events.description: The facility currently employs about 100 team members, with plans to increase headcount to 185 by 2024.

events.name: t: Environmental features
events.wd_description: The facility is powered by renewable energy and features onsite wastewater recycling and treatment systems.
events.description: The facility is powered by renewable energy and features onsite wastewater recycling and treatment systems.

events.name: Future expansion plans
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements aims to continue building its closed-loop battery materials supply chain to make EV batteries cleaner and more sustainable.
events.description: Ascend Elements aims to continue building its closed-loop battery materials supply chain to make EV batteries cleaner and more sustainable.
